sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"记忆，记住，回忆"之意。
means: memorize ： 指有意识的下功夫把某事的整个细节都记在脑子里。
remember ： 含义较广，多指无意识地回忆起往事，也可指通过主观努力去记忆。
recall比remember文雅，指想方设法回忆已经遗忘之事。
recollect ： 指在记忆中搜索，设法想起一时想不起的事情或人，强调过程。
remind ： 指经某人或某事的提醒而回忆起某件已遗忘之事。

word_mean: 回忆，回想：记忆中的人物、事件在意识中重现的过程
召回制药企业主要收集临床试验/验证、上市后监测以及定期文献检索信息，若有不良反应与药品质量有关，该批号的药品必须尽快收回。

sentence.Network_en: I recall many discussions with her on these and kindred topics.
sentence.Network_cn: 我回想起多次同她就这些问题及类似话题进行的讨论。

sentence.Network_en: As far as I can recall, Patti was a Smith.
sentence.Network_cn: 我记得帕蒂是姓史密斯的。

sentence.Network_en: The old-timers used to recall how hot 1886 was.
sentence.Network_cn: 老人们常常回想起1886年的酷热。

jx.jx_en_mean: in such a way that restoration is impossible
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不能被记起的；召唤不回来的，不能挽回的；不可取消的

lj.lj_ly: shopping developments have already blighted other parts of the city beyond recall.
lj.lj_ls: 购物业的发展已经将这座城市的其他几个区给彻底破坏了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as a verb): from re- 'again' + call, suggested by Latin revocare or French rappeler 'call back'

entry.def: When you recall something, you remember it and tell others about it.

example.ex: Henderson recalled that he first met Pollard during a business trip to Washington...
example.tran: 亨德森记起他第一次见到波拉德是在一次去华盛顿出差的时候。

example.ex: Her teacher recalled: 'She was always on about modelling.'...
example.tran: 她的老师回忆说：“她那时老是说要当模特。”

entry.tran: （用于引出双方都已意识到的事）记得
entry.def: You can say as I recall ,you might recall, or you will recall to someone that you are talking to when you want to mention something that you are both already aware of which is relevant to the discussion.

example.ex: As I recall, you're not on the board, Joe; you're only a minor shareholder...
example.tran: 我记得你并没有进董事会，乔，你只是一个小股东而已。

example.ex: You will recall that I sent you a warning of troubled times. Well now, almost everything I forecast has come about.
example.tran: 你还记得我警告过你时局会出现动荡吧。现在看来，几乎我预测的每件事都发生了。

entry.def: Recall is the ability to remember something that has happened in the past or the act of remembering it.

example.ex: He had a good memory, and total recall of her spoken words.
example.tran: 他记忆力很好，她当时说的话他全都记得起来。

entry.def: If you are recalled to your home, country, or the place where you work, you are ordered to return there.

example.ex: Spain has recalled its Ambassador after a row over refugees seeking asylum at the embassy...
example.tran: 在对难民到使馆寻求庇护一事产生严重分歧后，西班牙召回了其大使。

example.ex: Parliament was recalled from its summer recess.
example.tran: 国会在夏季休会之后又重新开议。

entry.def: In sport, if a player is recalled to a team, he or she is included in that team again after being left out.

example.ex: Dean Richards was recalled to the England squad for the match with Wales...
example.tran: 迪安·理查兹被召回英格兰队参加对阵威尔士的比赛。

example.ex: I had done enough after being recalled against Pakistan to have got on the tour to India.
example.tran: 在被征召入队参加与巴基斯坦的比赛后，我为前往印度的行程做了充分准备。

entry.def: If a company recalls a product, it asks the shops or the people who have bought that product to return it because there is something wrong with it.

example.ex: The company said it was recalling one of its drugs...
example.tran: 这个公司说正在召回他们生产的一种药。

example.ex: More than 3,000 cars were recalled yesterday because of a brake problem.
example.tran: 3,000多辆汽车因为刹车问题昨天被召回。

entry.tran: 记不起来；无法忆起；无法恢复原状；面目全非
entry.def: If something is beyond recall, it is no longer possible to remember how it was or to bring it back to its original condition.

example.ex: The ground has been polluted beyond recall...
example.tran: 这片土地已被污染得面目全非。

example.ex: ...the realities of operating a traditional canal boat can be readily imagined, even if the life itself is beyond recall.
example.tran: 经营一艘传统的运河船的现实情形很容易想象，尽管那种生活本身已经无法忆起了。

means.word_mean: 1. a request by the manufacturer of a defective product to return the product (as for replacement or repair)
3. a bugle call that signals troops to return
4. the process of remembering (especially the process of recovering information by mental effort);

sentences.sentence: "he has total recall of the episode"

means.word_mean: 5. the act of removing an official by petition
1. recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection;

sentences.sentence: "I can't remember saying any such thing"
"I can't think what her last name was"
"Do you remember that he once loved you?"
"This harks back to a previous remark of his"
"The ambassador was recalled to his country"
"The company called back many of the workers it had laid off during the recession"

means.word_mean: 5. cause one's (or someone else's) thoughts or attention to return from a reverie or digression;

sentences.sentence: "She was recalled by a loud laugh"

means.word_mean: 6. make unavailable; bar from sale or distribution;

sentences.sentence: "The company recalled the product when it was found to be faulty"
"The manufacturer tried to call back the spoilt yoghurt"

auth_sentence.res_content: The study was done in Israel as I recall.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The study was done in Israel as I recall.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"回,向后,相反,不"; 2. 表示"一再,重新"

stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+pugn打+ant……的→[把人]打回去→[行为]令人厌恶的
re回,向后,相反,不+son声音+ant……的→声音回过来→回响的
re反+vers转+e→反转的
re一再,重新+splend光辉+ent……的→再光辉→辉煌的
re回,向后,相反,不+neg否认+ade个人或集体→反过来否认原的[党]→背叛者
re回,向后,相反,不+peal驱动→反驱动→取消;参考:appeal呼吁
re不+prob正直+ate人→不正直→败坏
re向后+st站→立于后面者→其他的[人,物]
re一再,重新+cidiv掉下+ism行为,现象→再次掉入罪行
re一再,重新+pose放→再放下[工作]→休息
re一再,重新+surg升起,浪潮+ence表名词→重起浪潮→复兴
re回,向后,相反,不+proach接近→不接近→指责
re反+volt转→反过转→反叛
re回+call喊;想→回想
re回+flect弯曲→弯曲返回→反射
re回,向后,相反,不+linqu离开+ish表动词→离开不再要→放弃
re回,向后,相反,不+mov运动,移动+e→移开,消除
re回,向后,相反,不+pel推→击退
re反+sent感觉→反感→不满
re反+sist站→反着站→反抗
re回+tract拉→拉回,缩回
re回+treat→v.后退,撤退
re一再,重新+arrange安排→v.重新安排
re一再,重新+assure确保→v.消除某人疑虑
re一再,重新+capit头+ulate=ate表动词→重新把头拿出来→概括要点
re一再,重新+claim喊→喊回来→取回,引申为开垦荒地
re一再,重新+commend赞扬→一再赞扬
re一再,重新+furbish装饰→再装饰→刷新
re一再,重新+in入+carn肉+ate表动词→重新进入肉体→产生
re一再,重新+in入+state国家,权力→重新进入权力
re一再,重新+iterate重说→反复重说

stems_affixes.value_cn: 描述,表示,象征;代表;阐明
stems_affixes.word_buile: re一再+present出席的;上演→一再上演,出席的→象征;代表
re一再,重新+produce生产,制造→v. 生殖;再现;繁殖;复制
re一再,重新+verber震动+ate表动词→重新震动→起回声

Sentence.sentence: Call it the "learning paradox", the more you struggle and even fail while you're trying to learn new information, the better you're likely to recall and apply that information later.
Everything fell into a place", she recalls.

I don't attend services when I am there, and I have never meditated, there or anywhere; I just take walks and read and lose myself in the stillness, recalling that it is only by stepping briefly away from my wife and bosses and friends that I will have anything useful to bring to them.

sentences.en: As you may recall, he was in the army then.
sentences.cn: 你可能记得当时他正在从军。
这一情景使她想起了童年。

sentences.en: I don't recall where to meet her.
sentences.cn: 我不能记起在哪儿见过她。

sentences.en: John recalled attending school with Mary.
sentences.cn: 约翰回想起同玛丽一起上学的情景。

sentences.en: I recalled that he had mentioned the problem once.
sentences.cn: 我回忆起他曾经有一次提到过这个问题。

sentences.en: I can't recall where he lives.
The recall of the Ambassador was embarrassing for the country.
sentences.cn: 大使被召回使这个国家感到难堪。

sentences.en: He has complete recall and never forgets anything.
sentences.cn: 他有很好的记忆力, 从不忘记任何事。

jushi.english: The recall of the ambassador was embarrassing for the country.
jushi.chinese: 大使被召回使这个国家感到难堪。

jushi.english: He has complete recall and never forgets anything.
jushi.chinese: 他有很好的记忆力,从不忘记任何事。

jushi.english: As you may recall,he was in the army then.
jushi.chinese: 你可能记得当时他正从军。
